poem:
Title: Fragments of Dissent

Thick bleeding ink,
unfolds a city's grief,
Incendiary words, pounding the night -
officer's stray bullet to scholar's retreat.

Voices whirl, like red wind
in 2,000 throats chanting peace.
Yet, plastic cuffs in the quiet morning,
echoing arrest across scholarly streets.

Stolen academia, shattered in protest's beat.
Yet, within this silent concrete,
blooms the refrain - never retreat.
